intro: Thapsus sinuatum, commonly known as the sinuous thapsus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in moist, calcareous soils. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Thapsus sinuatum is typically found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
